head.note: This manuscript contains: Fragment of a Commentary on the treatise "de Cælesti Hierarchia" of Dionysius the Areopagite commencing in the middle of cap. vii. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 1 item.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Fragment of a Commentary on the treatise "de Cælesti Hierarchia" of Dionysius the Areopagite commencing in the middle of cap. vii.
msItem.note: See Add. 12,152, fol. 23 col. b, line 15

physDesc.p: Vellum leaves, several of which are much stained and torn, especially foll. 9 and 10. The quires are signed with letters (fol. 1 a), and each page is divided into two columns. These leaves are taken from a manuscript of the ixth cent.

collation.p: The quires are signed with letters (foll. 1 a)

item.p: Vellum leaves, several of which are much stained and torn, especially foll. 9, 10

layout.p: Each page is divided into two columns.

head.note: This manuscript contains: Theodosius, patriarch of Alexandria. The writings of Theodosius, patriarch of Alexandria; Severus of Antioch. A copy of a note, written by Severus ofAntioch in a volume belonging to the library of the convent of the Dalmatians (?), at the Enaton near Alexandria. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 11 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: The writings of Theodosius, patriarch of Alexandria
msItem.note: Cf. Renaudot, Hist. Patr. Alexandr. Jacob., p.136 ; Le Quien Or. Christ., t. ii., col. 431.

msItem.title: Portions of a discourse, addressed to the clergy of Constantinople, after he had been summoned thither by Justinian, in the course of which he supports his own opinions by quotations from Athanasius, Basil, Dionysius the Areopagite, Gregory Nazianzen, Gregory Nyssen, and Severus
Address read after the delivery of the above discourse
msItem.rubric: ܕܝܠܗ ܟܕ ܕܝܠܗ ܕܩܕܝܫܐ ܐܦܝ̈ܣܩܘܦܐ ܬܐܘܕܘܣܝܘܣ (marg ⲐⲀⲞⲆⲞⲤⲒⲞⲤ) ܪܝܫ ܐܦܝ̈ܣܩܘܦܐ (marg. ⲀⲠⲒⲤⲔⲞⲠⲀ) ܕܐܠܟܣܢܕܪܝܐ̣ ܦܪܘܣܦܢܝܣܝܣ (marg. ⲠⲢⲞⲤⲪⲞⲚⲤⲒⲤ) ܕܐܬ̣ܩܪܝܬܲ ܡܢ ܒܬܪ ܕܐܬܝ̣ܗܒ ܗ̣ܘ ܡܐܡܪܐ. ܗ̇ܝ ܕܡܚ̇ܘܐ ܠܢܝ̣ܫܗ̇܆ ܗ̣ܘ ܩܪܝܢܐ ܕܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܡ̈ܬܬ݁ܝܬܝܢ ܒܗ̇.
msItem.incipit: ܡܢ ܟܕܘ ܡ̇ܢ ܣܦܩܐܝܬ ܚܘܝܢܢ ܢܝܫܢ܇ ܡܠܘܢ ܕܝܢ ܬܫܒܘܚܬܐ ܫܠܝܚܝܬܐ ܕܐ̈ܒܗܝܢ ܩ̈ܕܝܫܐ ܘܠܒ̈ܝܫܝ ܠܐܠܗܐ̇. ܗ̇ܝ ܕܡܛܠ ܒ̈ܥܬܐ ܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܡܢ ܩܕܡ ܩܠܝܠ ܢܒܥ̈ܝ ܡܛܠ ܬܠܝܬܝܘܬܐ ܩܕܝܫܬܐ ܘܫܘܝ̣ܬ ܒܐܘܣܝܐ̇. ܘܡܬ݁ܒܪܢܫܢܘܬܐ ܦܪܘܩܝܬܐ ܕܡܛܠܬܢ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܚܕ ܡܢܗ̇ ܕܬܠܝܬܝܘܬܐ ܐܠܗܐ ܡܠܬܐ̇. ܒܝܕ ܡܐܡܪܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܟ̣ܬܒܢܢ ܗܫܐ ܘܝܗܒ̣ܢܢ̇. ܐܝܟ ܡܐ ܕܡܢܗ ܐܝܬ ܠܡܐ̇ܠܦ ܠܐ̇ܝܢܐ ܕܨ̇ܒܐ.

msItem.title: Five orders or canons
First canon
Second canon
Third canon
Fourth canon
Fifth canon
Formula signed by the priests and deacons in communion with Theodosius
msItem.rubric: ܦܚ̇ܡܐ ܕܐܪܡ̣ܝ ܐܝ̣ܕܐ ܕܐܬ̣ܝܗܒ ܠܩܕܝܫܐ ܘܛ̇ܘܒܬܢܐ ܪܝܫ ܐܦܝ̈ܣܩܦܐ ܕܐܠܟܣܢܕܪܝܐ ܬܐܘܕܘܣܝܘܣ̣. ܡܢ ܩܫܝ̈ܫܐ ܘܡ̈ܫܡܫܢܐ ܗ̇ܢܘܢ ܕܬܚܝܬ ܫܘܬܦܘܬܐ ܕܝܠܗ. ܠܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܦ ܫܪܪܗ̣ ܒܝܕ ܢܦܫܗ
msItem.incipit: ܐܢܐ ܦܠܢ ܩܫܝܫܐ̣ ܡ̇ܩܒܠ ܐܢܐ ܒ̈ܟܠܙܢܝܢ ܠܡܐܡܪܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܬܬ̣ܣܝܡ ܗܫܐ̇. ܡܢ ܩܕܝܫܐ ܘܛ̇ܘܒܬܢܐ ܬܐܘܕܘܣܝܘܣ ܪܝܫ ܐܦܝ̈ܣܩܘܦܐ ܕܐܠܟܣܢܕܪܝܐ: ܡܛܠ ܬܠܝܬܝܘܬܐ ܩܕܝܫܬܐ ܘܫܘܼܝܬ ܒܐܘܣܝܐ̣. ܘܢܩ̇ܦ ܐܢܐ ܠܟܠܗ̇ ܡ̇ܠܦܢܘܬܐ ܕܡܬܬܝܬܐ ܒܗ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: A copy of a note, written by Severus of Antioch in a volume belonging to the library of the convent of the Dalmatians (?), at the Enaton near Alexandria
msItem.rubric: ܐܝ̣ܣܘܢ̣ (marg. ⲀⲒⲤⲞⲚ) ܕܦܪܓܪܦܝ (marg. ⲠⲢⲄⲢⲪⲒ) ܕܟܝܪܬ ܐܝ̈ܕܘܗܝ ܕܩܕܝܫܐ ܦܛܪܝܪܟܐ ܕܝܠܢ ܣܐܘܪܐ: ܕܐܫ̣ܬܟܚܬ݁ ܒܟܬܒܐ ܕܕܝܪܐ ܕܕܠܡܛܝܐ (marg. ⲆⲖⲘⲦⲒⲀ) ܕܗ̣ܢܛܘܢ: (marg. ⲈⲚⲦⲞⲚ) ܕܐܝܬ ܗܘܘ ܒܗ̣ ܐܦ ܬܘܪ̈ܨܐ ܐܚܪ̈ܢܐ ܘܗܦܘ̈ܣܡܝܘܣܝܣ̇ (marg. ⲞⲈⲪⲞⲤⲘⲒⲞⲤⲒⲤ) ܐܘܟܝܬ ܫܘܘ̈ܕܥܐ ܕܟܝܪܬ ܐܝ̈ܕܘܗܝ ܕܝܠܗ ܕܐܒܘܢ ܩܕܝܫܐ:
msItem.incipit: ܚܪܡܐ ܥܠ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܓܒ̣ܠܗ̇ ܠܗܕܐ ܗܘܦܬܝܣܝܣ (marg. ⲈⲞⲠⲐⲤⲒⲤ) ܠܘܬ ܓܘܿܕܦܐ ܕܥܠ ܫܪܪܐ. ܏ܘܫ.
msItem.finalRubric: ܫܠܡ ܟܬܒܐ ܕܩܕܝܫܐ ܬܐܘܕܘܣܝܣ ܐܦܝܣܩܘܦܐ ܕܐܠܟܣܢܕܪܝܐ

physDesc.p: Eleven vellum leaves, about 10 5/8 in. by 7 1/8, of which the first two and the last are much stained and torn (Add. 14,541, foll. 39—49). Each page is divided into two columns, of from 37 to 41 lines.

item.p: The first two leaves and the last leaf are much stained and torn.

layout.p: Each page is divided into two columns, of from 37 to 41 lines.

handDesc.handNote: Written in a good, regular Estrangela of the viiith or ixth cent, See addition 1.
On the margins of the leaves there are many words written in Greek letters, of which those given above may suffice as specimens.

additions.note: N.B., items below may have been listed out of folio order in Wright's catalogue.

item.label: Colophon
item.p: After the doxology, there stands a note, now much mutilated, from which it appears that the name of the scribe was Thomas.

p.quote: ܕܟܝܪ̈ܝܢ ܟܠܗܘܢ ܩܕ̈ܝܫܘܗܝ ܕܡܪܢ ܕܐ[ܝܬ] ܒܟܠ ܐܬܪ. ܕܒܨ̈ܠܘܬܗܘܢ ܘܒܬܟ̈ܫܦܬܗܘܢ ܢܥܒܕ ܐܠܗܐ ܪ̈ܚܡܐ ܘܪܘܚܦܐ ܥܠ ܬܐܘܡܐ [ܚܛܝܐ] ܕܟܬ̣ܒ ܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܐܝܟ ܚܝܠܗ. ܏ܘܫ.

item.p: On the margins of the leaves there are many words written in Greek letters, of which the following are specimens

physDesc.p: Two vellum leaves, 10 7/8 in. by 7 1/8 (Add. 14,541, foll. 50, 51). Each page is divided into two columns of 34 lines.

layout.p: Each page is divided into two columns of 34 lines.

handDesc.handNote: The writing is a good, regular Estrangělā of the vith or viith cent.

head.note: This manuscript contains: Eusebius of Caesarea. An extract from Eusebius of Caesarea on the various nations of the earth, and who was the father of each of them. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 1 item.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: An extract from Eusebius of Caesarea on the various nations of the earth, and who was the father of each of them.
msItem.rubric: ܬܘܒ ܦܘܫܩܐ ܕܟܠܗ̈ܘܢ ܠܫ̈ܢܐ ܘܕܐܝܢܐ ܗܘ ܐܒܐ ܕܟܠ ܚܕ ܚܕ ܡܢܗ̈ܘܢ ܕܝܠܗ̈ܘܢ ܕܠܫ̈ܢܐ ܕܡ̈ܦܪܫܝܢ ܠܐܘܣܒܝܣ ܩܣܪܝܐ
msItem.incipit: ܒܢ̈ܝ ܝܦܬ ܓܡܪ ܐܘܠܕ ܓܘ̈ܛܝܐ ܘܓܪ̈ܡܢܝܐ ܘܣܪ̈ܡܛܝܐ: ܡܓܘܓ ܐܘܠܕ ܩܪ̈ܦܝܐ ܘܦܘ̈ܢܝܩܝܐ. ܡܕܝ ܐܘܠܕ ܡ̈ܕܝܐ ܘܓ̈ܠܝܐ. ܝܘܢ ܐܘܠܕ ܐ̈ܠܢܝܐ ܘܐܝܠܘܢ ܘܣ̈ܓܘܛܢܝܐ. ܏ܘܫ..

physDesc.p: A vellum leaf, 10 5/8 in. by 7 1/8. The page is divided into two columns, of from 33 to 35 lines.

layout.p: The page is divided into two columns, of from 33 to 35 lines.

handDesc.handNote: The writing is good and regular, of about the ixth cent.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.

category.catDesc: Catenae Patrum and Demonstrations against Heresies
Councils of the Church and Ecclesiastical Canons

langUsage.language: Arabic Garshuni in East Syriac script

revisionDesc.change: CHANGED: added or corrected folio extent values
CHANGED: updated incorrect form and/or material support designation
ADDED: supplied and corrected Syriaca.org URIs for authors
Changed: Files moved to srophe-app-data/data/manuscripts/tei repository.
